content.question: A <math alttext="4 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>4 kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object moving to the left collides with and sticks to a <math alttext="3 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>3 kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object moving to the right. Which of the following is true of the motion of the combined objects immediately after the collision?

choices.label: They must be moving to the left.
They must be moving to the right.
The motion cannot be determined without knowing the speeds of the objects before the collision.

content.answer: The motion cannot be determined without knowing the speeds of the objects before the collision.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
